page.title: 11Farming In The Newquay Area
page.content:
The farms in the area have recently been amalgamated into bigger units,and paddock grazing has been introduced. Farms have become specialised in order to produce food at competitive prices.
Dairying is the most profitable in the area,the main breed being Fresian. Most milk is sent to the dairy at Lostwithiel and some to the cheese factory at Davidstow.
Pigs are kept on 40% of the farms- they provide an additional source of income without using much land.
Sheep are kept on large farms as they need a large range.The main breed is the South Devon.Lambs are the main source of revenue:this area produces the earliest lambs in the country because of the mild winter weather.
